intro: Callista ochroleuca, commonly known as the yellow bell heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in heathland and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. It has small, leathery leaves and is often found in coastal regions. Callista ochroleuca is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
